page.title: 14FUTURE PLANS FOR CLAYHANGER.
page.content: The Clayhanger area in the past has suffered from the ravages of man.Local mining operations resulted in subsidence and part of the village became a water-filled hollow.This has been somewhat remedied by reclamation. However,future plans for Clayhanger could create new environmental problems.The Aldridge/Brownhills Local Plan envisages the building of 1200 houses whilst the National Coal Board wishes to begin opencast mining in the area.Furthermore,one proposed alternative road to relieve congestion on the M6 passes through land adjacent to Clayhanger.Such schemes could endanger the present village's character.The Urban Wild Life Group has objected to these plans as it is a Grade A site for natural conservation. They propose that the area be declared a Local Nature Reserve.
